description: The app is laid out very nicely and it's easy to create your own lessons via flashcards. Plus you can't beat the price :-)
summary: My wife and children are Japanese and this is helping me learn!

description: Great japanese free dictionary program (which I used on Windows before), but on Fedora 25, it didn't display both hiragana and katana characters.

I've been studying Japanese for a while, this thingy is ridiculously helpful.

You look up a kanji, click on it and it gives you COLOURED ANIMATIONS of the stroke order. Hover your mouse on it and it highlights the smaller compounds of bigger kanji which are simpler kanji by themselves. If you're a synaesthete like me, it's a super powerful mnemonic tool.

Also has romaji search, and flashcards (if you're that kinda person).

I'm going to endorse this even to my dog. Actually I don't have one - my dad's allergic.
